messages.subject: control etc.
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/13/02 2:07:52 AM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/13/02 2:07:52 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< My deal. I gave her more flour and told her
sorry for not listening right away. >>

That is really great!
Here's how I see it, they ask for something that you know will result in a
not so great end product. You can tell them what you think might happen and
then let them go ahead. What kind of experiments would parent's try to create
to "teach" them the very thing they are experimenting with all on their own.
She'll find out why things get dry if you add too much flour, how cool!
The school at home parent would pay money to create such and experiment. And
the mess? I look at that as part of the price of the "unschooling
curriculum". lol

Ren
